qas.question: Which CBC affiliate joined E! in February 2006?
Which affiliate left CBC due to an agreement with CHBC?
What two affiliates joined E! in late August, 2008 after which transmitters were not replaced?

answers.text: CKPG-TV Prince George and CHAT-TV Medicine Hat

qas.question: CJFC, CHAT, and CKPG are owned by whom?
The CBC is losing influence to what to broadcasting groups?
On what day in 2006, did the CBC lose a large percentage of their private affiliates due to the CHBC?
CHBC is the only broadcaster licensed in British Columbia after the CBC experienced a CRTC disagreement with what station?
What independent media company has attempted to merge with the CBC?
What is the CBC's largest challenge with retaining viewers?

context: Private CBC affiliates are not as common as they were in the past, as many such stations have been purchased either by the CBC itself or by <b4_0>Canwest Global or CHUM Limited,<b4_0/> respectively becoming E! or A-Channel (later A, now CTV Two) stations. One private CBC affiliate, <a0_0>CHBC-TV in Kelowna<a0_0/>, joined E! (then known as CH) on <b5_0>February 27<b5_0/>, 2006. When a private CBC affiliate reaffiliates with another network, the CBC has normally added a retransmitter of its nearest O&O station to ensure that CBC service is continued. However, due to an agreement between CHBC and <a1_0><b6_0>CFJC-TV in Kamloops<b6_0/><a1_0/>, CFJC also disaffiliated from the CBC on February 27, 2006, but no retransmitters were installed in the licence area. Former private CBC affiliates <a2_0>CKPG-TV Prince George and CHAT-TV Medicine Hat<a2_0/> disaffiliated on August 31, 2008 and joined E!, but the CBC announced it will not add new retransmitters to these areas. Incidentally, CFJC, CKPG and CHAT are all owned by an independent media company, <a3_0><b7_0>Jim Pattison Group<b7_0/><a3_0/>. With the closure of E! and other <b8_0>changes in the media landscape<b8_0/>, several former CBC affiliates have since joined City or Global, or closed altogether.
